Type.Name: AccelActivateArgs

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AccelActivateArgs extends GLib.SignalArgs

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: This class extends with information about an activated accelerator.

remarks.para: The event invokes delegates which pass event data via this class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of with the default values.
Docs.remarks: When manually evoking an delegate, this constructor is used create the second argument.

Docs.summary: Gets the object on which the accelerator was activated.
Docs.value: A containing the object on which the accelerator was activated.

Docs.summary: Gets the key value that was used to activate the accelerator.
Docs.value: A containing the key value that was used to activate the accelerator.

remarks.para: This value represents a specific non-modifier key on the keyboard.
A key combination may include a standard key and modifier keys, for example Ctrl-S. Check for the modifiers that were applied.

Docs.summary: Gets the mouse and keyboard modifier combination that was used to activate the accelerator.
Docs.value: A bitwise combined containing the mouse and keyboard modifier combination that was used to activate the accelerator.
Docs.remarks: Modifiers can include Ctrl, Shift, Alt, Meta keys (Windows, Apple), and mouse buttons. These are items that by themselves my perform no task, but when combined, often with , represent an accelerator. For example, Ctrl-S, Ctrl-Alt-Del, Ctrl-Left Mouse Button, or Apple-Control-Reset.
